activities.loc: Branch 5 Courthouse and Law Enforcement Center

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew M Hernandez

8:30 am Defendant Matthew M Hernandez in court in custody. Attorney Gideon Wertheimer in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Court:  There has not been a PH on the 3 felonies.  The PD's Ofc. have made over 400 atty contacts.  I'll make this a priority based on our new pilot program.
Court finds good cause to go beyond the time limits.
Hernandez argues for a sig. bond.  Have a job waiting and a residence to go to.....  Wertheimer objects to lowering the cash bond....  Serious felonies....
COURT:  You said JSS will allow you on GPS but I see a dead battery report.
Hernandez responds.
COURT comments.  Mr. Wertheimer, are there any witness issues?  Wertheimer:  No....
COURT:  I'll ask JSS to get a release plan, hopefully by 2:00 today since he's already on at 2:00 for a bond hearing, and we can recall it then.  It needs to be a very specific plan....

Def in custody
